channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Most Tiburon Peninsula special districts fail website transparency rules, grand jury finds
item.description: A Marin grand jury report reveals most Tiburon Peninsula agencies do not meet state transparency website standards. Only one agency fully complies.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A retired publicist in Tiburon finds ‘liberation’ in his Chevy Corvette
item.description: For Tiburon’s Mike Scippa, driving his naturally aspirated V8 Corvette is more than speed — it’s about freedom and connection.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Tiburon says it won’t cooperate with ICE amid federal crackdown
item.description: The Town Council will consider a sanctuary resolution in August, while the police chief says officers would seek to verify agent IDs.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Report: Tiburon and Belvedere will likely miss state’s housing targets for 2031
item.description: Civil grand jury says economic hurdles outweigh local opposition, posing major challenges for Marin communities.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere moves to fill police vacancy, launch new reserve recruitment effort
item.description: Belvedere moves to fill police staffing gaps by hiring a retiring officer’s replacement and multiple reserves to ease chronic understaffing.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Artist’s View open space in Belvedere to get overlook
item.description: Belvedere approves Artist’s View platform to expand public access and island views, using grant funds despite neighbor concerns over fire risk and cost.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Young knitters offer warmth, kindness, one square at a time
item.description: A group of Reed Union School District students has knitted a 40-inch-by-40-inch blanket to give to new immigrants arriving in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez
